00013 struct HelloWorld {
00014   NPP npp;
00015   NPObject *npobject;
00016 };
00017 
00018 // This file implements functions that the plugin is expected to implement so
00019 // that the browser can all them.  All of them are required to be implemented
00020 // regardless of whether this is a trusted or untrusted build of the module.
00021 
00022 
00023 // Called after NP_Initialize with a Plugin Instance Pointer and context
00024 // information for the plugin instance that is being allocated.
00025 // Declaration: npapi.h
00026 // Documentation URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en/NPP_New
00027 NPError NPP_New(NPMIMEType mime_type,
00028                 NPP instance,
00029                 uint16_t mode,
00030                 int16_t argc,
00031                 char* argn[],
00032                 char* argv[],
00033                 NPSavedData* saved) {
00034   if (instance == NULL)
00035     return NPERR_INVALID_INSTANCE_ERROR;
00036 
00037   struct HelloWorld *hello_world = NULL;
00038   hello_world = new HelloWorld;
00039   hello_world->npp = instance;
00040   hello_world->npobject = NULL;
00041 
00042   instance->pdata = hello_world;
00043   return NPERR_NO_ERROR;
00044 }
00045 
00046 // Called when a Plugin |instance| is being deleted by the browser.  This
00047 // function should clean up any information allocated by NPP_New but not
00048 // NP_Initialize.  Use |save| to store any information that should persist but
00049 // note that browser may choose to throw it away.
00050 // In the NaCl module, NPP_Destroy is called from NaClNP_MainLoop().
00051 // Declaration: npapi.h
00052 // Documentation URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en/NPP_Destroy
00053 NPError NPP_Destroy(NPP instance, NPSavedData** save) {
00054   if (NULL == instance)
00055     return NPERR_INVALID_INSTANCE_ERROR;
00056 
00057   // free plugin
00058   if (NULL != instance->pdata) {
00059     HelloWorld* hello_world = static_cast<HelloWorld*>(instance->pdata);
00060     delete hello_world;
00061     instance->pdata = NULL;
00062   }
00063   return NPERR_NO_ERROR;
00064 }
00065 
00066 // NPP_GetScriptableInstance returns the NPObject pointer that corresponds to
00067 // NPPVpluginScriptableNPObject queried by NPP_GetValue() from the browser.
00068 // Helper function for NPP_GetValue to create this plugin's NPObject.
00069 // |instance| is this plugin's representation in the browser.  Returns the new
00070 // NPObject or NULL.
00071 // Declaration: local
00072 // Documentation URL: N/A (not actually an NPAPI function)
00073 NPObject *NPP_GetScriptableInstance(NPP instance) {
00074   struct HelloWorld* hello_world;
00075 
00076   extern NPClass *GetNPSimpleClass();
00077 
00078   if (NULL == instance) {
00079     return NULL;
00080   }
00081   hello_world = static_cast<HelloWorld*>(instance->pdata);
00082   if (NULL == hello_world->npobject) {
00083     hello_world->npobject = NPN_CreateObject(instance, GetNPSimpleClass());
00084   }
00085   if (NULL != hello_world->npobject) {
00086     NPN_RetainObject(hello_world->npobject);
00087   }
00088   return hello_world->npobject;
00089 }
00090 
00091 // Implemented so the browser can get a scriptable instance from this plugin.
00092 // Declaration: npapi.h
00093 // Documentation URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en/NPP_GetValue
00094 NPError NPP_GetValue(NPP instance, NPPVariable variable, void* ret_value) {
00095   if (NPPVpluginScriptableNPObject == variable) {
00096     void** v = reinterpret_cast<void**>(ret_value);
00097     *v = NPP_GetScriptableInstance(instance);
00098     return NPERR_NO_ERROR;
00099   } else {
00100     return NPERR_GENERIC_ERROR;
00101   }
00102 }

00104 // |window| contains the current state of the window in the browser.  If this
00105 // is called, that state has probably changed recently.
00106 // Declaration: npapi.h
00107 // Documentation URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en/NPP_SetWindow
00108 NPError NPP_SetWindow(NPP instance, NPWindow* window) {
00109   return NPERR_NO_ERROR;
00110 }

00112 extern "C" {
00113 // When the browser calls NP_Initialize the plugin needs to return a list
00114 // of functions that have been implemented so that the browser can
00115 // communicate with the plugin.  This function populates that list,
00116 // |plugin_funcs|, with pointers to the functions.
00117 NPError InitializePluginFunctions(NPPluginFuncs* plugin_funcs) {
00118   memset(plugin_funcs, 0, sizeof(*plugin_funcs));
00119   plugin_funcs->version = NPVERS_HAS_PLUGIN_THREAD_ASYNC_CALL;
00120   plugin_funcs->size = sizeof(*plugin_funcs);
00121   plugin_funcs->newp = NPP_New;
00122   plugin_funcs->destroy = NPP_Destroy;
00123   plugin_funcs->setwindow = NPP_SetWindow;
00124   plugin_funcs->getvalue = NPP_GetValue;
00125   return NPERR_NO_ERROR;
00126 }
00127 
00128 }  // extern "C"
